item.title: Terra add a quote by Chris McCormack
item.description: "Fact One: Races are won or lost in key moments. Fact Two: Success in the sport is, above all else, about enduring suffering." -- Chris McCormack

item.title: Terra add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "This is what happened in love. One of you cried a lot and then both of you grew sarcastic." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Terra add a quote by Mark Z. Danielewski
item.description: "Passion has little to do with euphoria and everything to do with patience. It is not about feeling good. It is about endurance. Like patience, passion comes from the same Latin root: pati. It does not mean to flow with exuberance. It means to suffer." -- Mark Z. Danielewski

item.title: Terra add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Terra add a quote by Mary Gaitskill & Jim Shepard Richard Ford
item.description: "My ambition was to live like music." -- Mary Gaitskill & Jim Shepard Richard Ford

item.title: Terra add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Terra add a quote by Mary Gaitskill
item.description: "Of course there’s something there; unfortunately, there’s always something ‘there.’ Something you will one day be sorry you saw." -- Mary Gaitskill

item.title: Terra add a quote by Lydia Davis
item.description: "Heart weeps. Head tries to help heart. Head tells heart how it is, again: You will lose the ones you love. They will all go. But even the earth will go, someday. Heart feels better, then. But the words of head do not remain long in the ears of heart. Heart is so new to this. I want them back, says heart. Head is all heart has. Help, head. Help heart." -- Lydia Davis

item.title: Terra add a quote by Christopher McDougall
item.description: "Sometimes,' she said, 'it takes a woman to bring out the best in a man." -- Christopher McDougall

item.title: Terra add a quote by Christopher McDougall
item.description: "...there was some kind of connection between the capacity to love and the capacity to love *running*. The engineering was certainly the same: both depended on loosening your grip on your own desires, putting aside what you wanted and appreciating what you've got, being patient and forgiving and... undemanding...maybe we shouldn't be surprised that getting better at one could make you better at the other." -- Christopher McDougall

item.title: Terra add a quote by Christopher McDougall
item.description: "We wouldn't be alive without love we wouldn't have survived without running maybe we shouldn't be surprised that getting better at one could make you better at the other." -- Christopher McDougall

item.title: Terra add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "I can be a regular bitch. Just try me." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Terra add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "She went around with the attitude that she would rather be beaten to death than take any shit." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Terra add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "What she had realised was that love was that moment when your heart was about to burst." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Terra add a quote by Stieg Larsson
item.description: "Salander was the woman who hated men who hate women." -- Stieg Larsson

item.title: Terra add a quote by Mary Gaitskill
item.description: "When John took those naked pictures, the most popular singer was a girl with a tiny stick body and a large deferential head, who sang in a delicious lilt of white lace and promises and longing to be close. When she shut herself up in her closet and starved herself to death, people were shocked. But starvation was in her voice all along. That was the poignancy of it. A sweet voice locked in a dark place, but focused entirely on the tiny strip of light coming under the door. I drop the rag in the bucket and smoke some more, ashing into the sink,. A tiny piece of the movie from the naked time plays on my eyeball: A psychotic killer is blowing up amusement parks. At the head of the crowd clamoring to ride the roller coaster is a slim, lovely man with long blond hair and floppy clothes and big, beautiful eyes fixed on a tiny strip of light that only he can see." -- Mary Gaitskill

item.title: Terra add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "If you know you're worth nothing, only a gamble with death can gratify your vanity." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Terra add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Terra add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Want to talk third wave feminism, you could cite Ariel Levy and the idea that women have internalized male oppression. Going to spring break at Fort Lauderdale, getting drunk, and flashing your breasts isn't an act of personal empowerment. It's you, so fashioned and programmed by the construct of patriarchal society that you no longer know what's best for yourself. A damsel too dumb to even know she's in distress." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Terra add a quote by Buddhist saying
item.description: "In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you." -- Buddhist saying

item.title: Terra add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Tough old world, baby. If you're not bolted together tightly, you're gonna shake, rattle, and roll before you turn thirty." -- Stephen King
